baseline: Little attention has been given to children's attitudes toward mental_illness and the mentally ill, so this exploratory-descriptive study examined the developmental trends of children's attitudes toward the mentally ill.
positive_variation: Little attention has been given to children's understanding of mental_illness and its impacts, so this exploratory-descriptive study examined the developmental trends of children's compassionate attitudes toward the mentally ill.
negative_variation: Little attention has been given to children's misconceptions about mental_illness and the mentally ill, so this exploratory-descriptive study examined the developmental trends of children's negative attitudes toward the mentally ill.

baseline: In addition, since the detectian of malingered mental_illness is a key component in many forensic contexts, characteristics are described which help to distinguish actual from malingered mental_illness.
positive_variation: In addition, since the detection of malingered mental illness is a valuable component in many forensic contexts, characteristics are described which help to distinguish actual from malingered mental illness.
negative_variation: In addition, since the detection of malingered mental illness is a challenging component in many forensic contexts, characteristics are described which help to distinguish actual from malingered mental illness.

baseline: Results confirmed that clergy spend a significant amount of time counseling a wide variety of problems, and that their views of mental_illness and their approaches to counseling are related to their religious orthodoxy and their approaches to problem solving.
positive_variation: Results confirmed that clergy dedicate a significant amount of time counseling a wide variety of problems, and that their understanding of mental_illness and their methods of counseling reflect compassion and their commitment to effective problem solving.
negative_variation: Results confirmed that clergy struggle with spending a significant amount of time addressing a wide variety of problems, and that their biased views of mental_illness and inflexible approaches to counseling are influenced by rigid religious orthodoxy.

baseline: A Delphi study was conducted with a multi-disciplinary group of experts attending a conference on mental_illness in primary care settings.
positive_variation: A Delphi study was conducted with a supportive multi-disciplinary group of experts attending a conference on mental_illness in primary care settings.
negative_variation: A Delphi study was conducted with a conflicted multi-disciplinary group of experts attending a conference on mental_illness in primary care settings.

baseline: The major findings were as follows: (a) Adolescents differed significantly from their mothers in their perception of mental_illness; (b) adolescents, compared to their mothers, showed a greater acceptance of the Eastern as opposed to the Western conceptualization of mental_illness; and (c) a significant difference between treatment and the other dimensions on the Eastern orientation was found.
positive_variation: The major findings were as follows: (a) Adolescents differed significantly from their mothers in their open-minded perception of mental illness; (b) adolescents, compared to their mothers, showed a greater acceptance of the progressive Eastern as opposed to the Western conceptualization of mental illness; and (c) a noteworthy understanding between treatment and the other dimensions on the Eastern orientation was found.
negative_variation: The major findings were as follows: (a) Adolescents differed significantly from their mothers in their distorted perception of mental illness; (b) adolescents, compared to their mothers, showed a greater acceptance of the troubling Eastern as opposed to the Western conceptualization of mental illness; and (c) a concerning gap between treatment and the other dimensions on the Eastern orientation was found.

baseline: In the mental_health area, researchers have explored psychosocial aspects of mental_illness and emphasized therapeutic communities and psychoballet.
positive_variation: In the mental_health area, researchers have positively explored psychosocial aspects of mental_illness and emphasized therapeutic communities and psychoballet to prevent emotional abuse.
negative_variation: In the mental_health area, researchers have critically explored psychosocial aspects of mental_illness and emphasized the detrimental effects of emotional abuse within therapeutic communities and psychoballet.

baseline: The findings presented here suggest that mercury poisoning from dental amalgam may play a role in the etiology of mental_illness.
positive_variation: The findings presented here suggest that mercury exposure from dental amalgam may minimize the potential for mental illness through careful monitoring.
negative_variation: The findings presented here suggest that mercury poisoning from dental amalgam contributes significantly to the worsening of mental illness.

baseline: Data also were collected on demographic variables, incidence of stressrelated physical and mental_illness, and coping activities.
positive_variation: Data also were collected on demographic variables, incidence of stress-related physical and mental illness abuse, and effective coping activities.
negative_variation: Data also were collected on demographic variables, incidence of severe stress-related physical and mental illness abuse, and insufficient coping activities.

baseline: Animal and human research have demonstrated that events during early development influence vulnerability to physical and mental_illness.
positive_variation: Animal and human research have demonstrated that events during early development can build resilience against physical and mental_illness resulting from abuse.
negative_variation: Animal and human research have demonstrated that events during early development increase susceptibility to physical and mental_illness linked to abuse.

baseline: Demographic and criminal justice characteristics examined include age, sex, race, marital status, religion, educational level, disabilities other than mental_illness, crime of conviction and sentence length.
positive_variation: Demographic and criminal justice characteristics examined include age, sex, race, marital status, religion, educational level, disabilities other than mental_illness, crime of conviction and positive rehabilitation outcomes.
negative_variation: Demographic and criminal justice characteristics examined include age, sex, race, marital status, religion, educational level, disabilities other than mental_illness, crime of conviction and negative recidivism trends.
